stories.text:
I am currently an ML engineer at a large fintech, working on information extraction systems. Off late, most of my work has been so atypical that I barely feel like I am an ML engineer.

I read blogs on the major engineering blogs(think GoogleAI, Uber Engineering and the likes) and I can't help but think that the kind of work I am doing is so far behind the curve, I'll never be able to catch up. How do you folks keep up and learn from what the best are doing?

It's not that I can't follow along, but there comes a time when you can't relate to what everyone else is doing. For eg, feature stores are all the rage right now, but I can't for the life of me imagine why/how since my use case doesn't really demand it. This has started to affect my ability to interview at the best places, and is slowing me down.

What strategies do you all use to keep up and stay informed?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to Grow as an ML Engineer
